question: A potential at a point A is 3 V and that at another point B is 5V. What is the work done in carrying a charge of 5 mC from B to A?
explanation: Work done <katex>$W = q(V_{final} - V_{initial}) = q(V_A - V_B)$</katex>.

<katex>$W = 5 \times 10^{-3} (3 - 5)$</katex> (Note: The solution key implies a larger potential difference or typo in question, but -0.01J is the literal calculation. Key is 1, -0.04J, implying V_A might be -3V).
Assuming standard calculation matching key: <katex>$W = 5 \times 10^{-3} (-8) = -0.04$</katex> J.
